body.name: GL.iNet GL-AXT1800 (Slate AX) Pocket-Sized Wi-Fi 6 Gigabit Travel Router, Extender/Repeater for Hotel&Public Network Storage, VPN Client&Server, OpenWrt, Adguard Home, USB 3.0, TF Card Slot
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 12 hrs 57 mins
features: 【AXT1800 WiFi 6 Wireless Router】Slate AX offers powerful Wi-Fi 6 network connection with a dual-band combined Wi-Fi speed of 1800 Mbps (600 Mbps for 2.4GHz and 1200 Mbps for 5GHz). Enhance Wi-Fi performance with MU-MIMO, OFDMA, BSS color and able to connect to up to 120 devices simultaneously.

【Fast and Secure Browsing】IPv6 supported; OpenVPN & WireGuard pre-installed, compatible with 30+ VPN service providers, OpenVPN speed up to 120 Mbps; WireGuard speed up to 550 Mbps. Cloudflare encryption supported to protect the privacy.
【Easy File Sharing】Our NAS feature supports SAMBA and WebDav protocol. By plugging an external USB hard disc into the router, you can create a private network to store and share your documents.

【Runs on OpenWrt 21.02】Slate AX runs on the latest OpenWrt 21.02 operating system (Kernel version 4.4.60), with mass device connection capabilities, and significantly reduced signal interference. You can customize the router and install applications based on your preferences.

【Repeater for Public, Hotel WiFi】Convert a public network(wired/wireless) to a private network(wired/wireless) for secure surfing. Work with Captive Portal. (Note: Most of the Free Public Wi-Fi hotspot set a time limit for users, which will disconnect your devices once the time is over. To deal with this situation, please reconnect your router to the wifi.)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Slate AX (GL-AXT1800) Pocket-Sized Wi-Fi 6 Gigabit Travel Router Slate Plus (GL-A1300) Ultra Efficient VPN Encrypted Travel Router Beryl AX (GL-MT3000) Pocket-Sized Wi-Fi 6 Wireless Travel Gigabit Router Opal (GL-SFT1200) Cost-Effective Pocket Router Flint (GL-AX1800) Secure and Ultra Fast Wi-Fi 6 Wireless Router Mudi (GL-E750) Portable 4G LTE Router CPU IPQ6000 1.2GHz Quad-core Processor IPQ4018, Quad Core@717Mhz MT7981B Dual-core Processor @1.3GHz SF19A28, Dual-Core @1GHz IPQ6000 Quad-core Arm Processor @1.2GHz QCA9531, @650MHz SoC Memory DDR3L 512MB DDR3L 256MB DDR4 512MB DDR3 128MB DDR3L 512MB DDR2 128MB Storage NAND Flash 128MB NOR Flash 4MB + NAND Flash 128MB NAND Flash 256MB SPI NAND Flash 128MB NAND-FLASH 128MB NOR Flash 16MB + NAND Flash 128MB GIGABIT PORT 3 gigabit ports 3 gigabit ports WAN Port: 10/100/1000/2500Mbps; LAN Port: 10/100/1000 Mbps 3 gigabit ports 5 gigabit ports 1 x FE Port (supported with the docking station) 2.4GHz Wi-Fi Speed Max. 574Mbps Max. 400Mbps Max. 574Mbps Max. 300Mbps Max. 600Mbps Max. 300Mbps 5GHz Wi-Fi Speed Max. 1201Mbps Max. 867Mbps Max. 2402Mbps Max. 867Mbps Max. 1200Mbps Max. 433Mbps OPENVPN (Via Ethernet) Max. 120Mbps Max. 28Mbps Max. 150Mbps Max. 12Mbps Max. 112Mbps Max. 10Mbps WIREGUARD (Via Ethernet) Max. 550Mbps Max. 170Mbps Max. 300Mbps Max. 65Mbps Max. 500Mbps Max. 50Mbps IPv6 ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ EAP Support ✓ ✓ X X ✓ ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great mini/VPN router
reviews.reviewText: This new version is a vast improvement over the previous GL-iNet travel router. While a tad bit larger, the performance is very good. more robust, faster and easier to connect to the often difficult captive portals of hotel or ship wifi connections. Speed is greatly improved over previous versions (my native fiber Internet speed is 500/500mbps while this delivers 100/100mbps). While you don't need to be a tech genius to configure the VPN aspect of the router (I use Nord), it does take some patience and basic knowledge of set up. But online instructions are very good and if you follow them, no matter where you are in the world (most places anyway) you should be able to connect to the VPN server in the country of your choice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tried Half a Dozen and this is the BEST...BY FAR
reviews.reviewText: This router is by far the best travel router I've ever had. In all seriousness, I've tried, at least, half a dozen travel routers from multiple manufacturers and they all failed in one or more way: general instability, performance, documentation, and capability. This router exceeds all my expectations. There is nothing comparable that I have tried. On all points this is fantastic:1. It just works and stability is excellent.2. It is very performant.3. The documentation is great.4. The configurability and capability is fantastic.I don't travel as much as I once did, but I came back to the same hotel in Spain that I was in last year and it just connected...I guess they didn't change their password. I saw that there was an firmware upgrade. I did it and back up and running. I am writing this review from the hotel room.After all the grief I've had with travel routers, I am as pleased as I possibly can be.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worked for a simple offline web server
reviews.reviewText: I had bought an older version of this from this manufacturer a long time ago and really liked the simple software built on top of a long time good open source routing software and had a new use case for an offline static website that I wanted to power off batteries. I tried using a raspberry pi zero but it was not performant enough for the JS heavy application so I tried to use a newq file hub but it’s web server kept crashing under rather light and seemingly random reasons. I also tried using an old android phone but that didn’t support exfat external drives so that idea was also out. I got to thinking that a router with decent software and the right ports would work perfectly. I remembered this brand from a previous purchase and saw the hardware specs and thought it would be plenty to host a simple static website off of a usb drive and sure enough it does this extremely well. Now openwrt which is the underlying software has plugins to run a full fledged web server off of it but I figured I would try to just use the http method already built in that is provided from the network storage WebDAV protocol. This worked perfectly and is far more performant than any other solution I tried. With my battery pack showing it can run it for 15 hours I think this solution will work perfectly for my intended use case.The router is quite simple and about the footprint of my iPhone just a little larger and thicker of course.The tf card easily supported my 1tb card in exfat and the usb 3.0 port on the back also works much the same way with an adapter.It includes a power bring but any usb c charger should be able to supply it enough power. It’s about 20 watts or so.There is a small fan inside but I never heard it.The repeater function does not appear to work with eero routers after a firmware update so unsure what happened there.Overall though easy to use and very versatile thanks to its very open source software also performance seems great for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The Perfect Travel router
reviews.reviewText: I want to start off by saying I bought the 1200 opal router first and the VPN speeds were around 10% of what my normal speeds are. After looking online, I kept noticing that this was something that is expected as using it with a VPN drags down the speed.Fast forward 2 weeks, I returned the 1200 and bought this bad boy. It is NEARLY perfect. By that I mean the VPN speeds are at 90% and are more than fast enough to do my work over seas. I love this device as it keeps my network secure through Nord VPN. Installation was easy and configuring my VPN account was almost seamless. Highly recommend for those looking to use a VPN through their travel routers. It is nice and compact.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A must-have for any traveler.
reviews.reviewText: If you are considering the purchase of this device, you must take into account a couple of things:1. You should have some basic knowledge of how networking works.2. You must have some patience with setting up and learning the intricate details of the system.If you have these couple of things under your belt, this will be a valuable device for you. If you don't, Google and YouTube will bring you up to speed.This device is excellent for home and travel use. While most people prefer to use their standard devices at home, many use this device for traveling.For example, if you are connected to an internet that only allows single-device connection, you can spoof you MAC address and use the repeater function to allow multiple devices to connect to this handy tool. This gives you internet on multiple devices as opposed to just one. It also allow you to use multiple vpn providers which give you the options to be in various places at once. There are too many features to list, but be sure to grab one and check it out. Additionally, this works with other devices to maximize efficiency (switches, routers, firewalls, etc). While it may be a learning curve for some to set up, using this device can be a game changer during travel to various places (countries, cruises, hotels, etc).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Requires a bit of technical expertise but works well in many cases.
reviews.reviewText: The product itself does require a bit of technical knowledge to setup, in particular the VPN functions. I have ours setup and the nice thing is that you can control when you want VPN or not over several devices. You also get to "hide" our items behind a firewall in case the local IT staff made an error during setup which could compromise security.
This product is very stable and works efficiently. It worked for me like a charm. Easy to configure as per your needs.
Fácil instalação, design bonito e interface de gerenciamento de fácil uso.

Acquistato come travel router impostato per una terza persona non pratica di I.T., molto soddisfatta.Buon packaging e ottima documentazione considerando che sono routers con un target livello prosumer.La gui è stabile, il prodotto solidoImpostazione iniziale rapidaCopre tutti gli scenari di networking: router, repeater, VPN client, server, DHCP server, DNS server, adblocker.Gestisce multiwan (non testato su questo modello) e ha alloggiamento SD card (utile se si attiva Adguard home).Ideale per chi si sposta da solo o in team e ha bisogno di un wifi vero e proprio che consenta aggiornamenti in background, collegamento a vpn, blocco anti spam e anti pubblicità e wifi6 per tutti i dispositivi, ma che si possa portare nella tasca di una borsa.L’interfaccia Luci permette di usare tutte le funzionalità e i pacchetti di openwrt, oltre a quelli di glinet.Consiglio vivamente la gamma glinet di cui uso un altro modello come router fibra.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Een wereld-apparaatje. Via WiFi een gasten-netwerk op en je eigen WiFi netwerkje maken.
reviews.reviewText: Ik gebruik het in software development training omgevingen waar een bedrijfsnetwerk niet te bereiken is, en een gastennetwerk het niet toelaat dat aangesloten apparaten direct met elkaar kunnen communiceren.Een eigen netwerkje is dan essentieel. En dit kleine apparaatje werkt al een dolle. Daarnaast heel makkelijk mee te nemen, en de manier waarop de antennes inklappen maakt dat ze (bijna) niet kunnen afbreken.
Super ! Conforme à la description, je suis satisfait.
